resources.string: Qoutes Application
"The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart." \n - Helen Keller
"The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today." \n - H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
"If you believe in yourself and have dedication and pride - and never quit, you'll be a winner." \n - Paul Bryant
"A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him." \n - David Brinkley
"No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." \n - Eleanor Roosevelt
"I believe that the only courage anybody ever needs is the courage to follow your own dreams." \n - Oprah Winfrey
“All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.” \n —Walt Disney
“It’s hard to beat a person who never gives up.” \n —Babe Ruth
“You’ve gotta dance like there’s nobody watching, love like you’ll never be hurt, sing like there’s nobody listening, and live like it’s heaven on earth.” \n —William W. Purkey
“When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.” \n ―Helen Kelle
“Your passion is waiting for your courage to catch up.” \n —Isabelle Lafleche
“If something is important enough, even if the odds are stacked against you, you should still do it.” \n —Elon Musk
“If you believe it’ll work out, you’ll see opportunities. If you don’t believe it’ll work out, you’ll see obstacles.” \n ―Wayne Dyer
“Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.” \n ―Theodore Roosevelt
“You can waste your lives drawing lines. Or you can live your life crossing them.” \n ―Shonda Rhimes
“If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.” \n ―Kurt Cobain
“Work hard in silence, let your success be the noise.” \n ―Frank Ocean
Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.” \n ―Earl Nightingale
“If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.” \n ―Napoleon Hill
“Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.” \n ―Arthur Ashe
